results.title: I spy. Total loss
results.creator_credit: Shamley International Productions and Alfred J Hitchcock Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Alfred Hitchcock presents”.
Two more fine tales from the vault of the master of the macabre. “I spy”: Pompous old Captain Morgan’s wife has up and left him, without so much as a note to let him know where she is. So he has hired private detective, Mr. Fruit to spy on her and see what she’s up to. Mr. Fruit poses as a waiter at the restaurant where she works and waits to see if she has found a gentleman friend… “Total loss”: A widow is left with a clothing business, but her head for business is no match for her sense of style. She is in debt and beginning to get desperate when she is tempted by an insurance scam…

results.title: I Spy. The English roses
results.creator_credit: Maurice Sellar, Robert Sidaway and Rank Film Distributors
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Best of British”.
I spy is a fascinating compilation of British spy films such as Alfred Hitchcock’s “The Lady vanishes”. Included is an interesting comparative analysis of the 1935, 1959 and 1978 versions of “The 39 steps.” “The English roses” spotlights six of Britain’s most beautiful and talented leading actresses in a range of roles which won the hearts of many viewers. Actresses covered include Deborah Kerr, Phyllis Calvert, Margaret Lockwood, Jean Simmons, Patricia Roc and Virginia McKenna. Narrated by Sir John Mills.

results.title: I spell I can't...I can!
results.creator_credit: Edie Collet, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Edie Collet’s beginnings were difficult - her mother died giving birth and she was diagnosed as being handicapped. Collet was raised by her father and siblings to become an educated, well travelled and independent adult. Collet was told she would never work but she proved them wrong. This story is dedicated to Collet’s dad.

results.title: I Shot Andy Warhol [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Mary Harron, Tom Kalin, Christine Vachon, BBC-TV, Samuel Goldwyn Company and Playhouse International Pictures
results.brief_description: A fact-based drama about Valerie Solanas, the lesbian feminist writer who achieved her fifteen minutes of fame after shooting Manhattan pop artist/guru Andy Warhol in 1968. Solanas was a peripheral figure in Warhol’s Factory studio scene in New York during the late Sixties, and the founder and sole member of her ‘Society for Cutting Up Men’ (SCUM). Her SCUM manifesto has since become a feminist classic. The film focuses on her troubled life, as broke, homeless and psychologically unstable she turns to begging and prostitution to survive. Convinced that Warhol’s support could change her life, she becomes violently enraged when the artist and his friends begin to turn away from her. Cast includes Lili Taylor, Stephen Dorff and Jared Harris.

results.title: I See a dark stranger = The Adventuress
results.creator_credit: Frank Launder, Sidney Gilliat and Individual Pictures
results.brief_description: The shadowy world of German espionage in wartime Britain. Bridie Quilty has grown up in the west of Ireland under the influence of her father’s nationalism and becomes an innocent member of a German spy network. When she discovers secret plans for the D-Day landings - and falls in love with an English officer on leave - she faces her moment of truth on the Isle of Man in the climax of this atmospheric thriller. Stars Deborah Kerr, Trevor Howard and Raymond Huntley.

results.title: I own the racecourse
results.creator_credit: Darrol Blake, Anna Home and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Round the World”.
A heartwarming and humorous story from the novel by Patricia Wrightson. Set in Sydney, a backward child named Andy buys a racecourse for three dollars from a tramp.

results.title: I owe you
results.brief_description: Designed to encourage managers to consider their influence on the development of subordinate managers and supervisors. Highlights the dissatisfaction and frustrations aroused in subordinates when a manager overlooks their natural desire for development in their jobs. Describes the main points of an action plan devised to solve a work problem and improve subordinate skills.

results.title: I never loved you
results.creator_credit: Cassandra Tytler, Rebecca McPherson, Corinne Preston and Monkey Suit Productions
results.brief_description: Broken hearts, longing and regret…..”I Never loved you” does a tango and a twirl around the question of love. It exalts in the high passion and tragedy of love and romance, all the while too aware that love can be finite and fleeting. Tough guys singing tender songs to gals with innocent hearts but eyes that have seen too much; doe-eyed lovers are left with bloodshot eyes, nursing regret and a broken heart; the carousel of love moves on, passion can make you giddy and then throw you off balance. Where did it all go wrong? Cast includes: Alex Ben Mayor, Louise Woodward, Connal Parsley, Charlie Sheldon.
